algebraic.dist 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Articles
    Empirical distribution Multivariate normal distribution

Function reference

All functions

cdf()
Generic method for obtaining the cdf of an object.
cdf(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the cdf of empirical_dist object x.
cdf(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the cdf of an exp_dist object.
cdf(<normal>)
Method for obtaining the cdf of an normal object.
conditional()
Generic method for obtaining the conditional distribution of a distribution object x given condition P.
conditional(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the condition distribution, x | P(x), of empirical_dist object x.
dim(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the dimension of a empirical_dist object.
edist()
takes an expression e and a list vars and returns a lazy dist (distribution object).
empirical_dist()
Construct empirical distribution object.
exp_dist()
Construct exponential distribution object.
expectation()
Generic method for obtaining the expectation of f with respect to x.
expectation(<dist>)
Expectation operator applied to object of type dist with respect to a function g. That is, E(g(object)).
expectation(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the expectation of empirical_dist object x under function g.
expectation(<exp_dist>)
This is the expectation of a function g with respect to an exponential distribution x of type exp_dist.
hazard()
Generic method for obtaining the hazard function of an object.
hazard(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the hazard function of an exp_dist object.
is_dist()
Function to determine whether an object x is a dist object.
is_edist()
Function to determine whether an object x is an expr_dist object.
is_empirical_dist()
Function to determine whether an object x is an empirical_dist object.
is_exp_dist()
Function to determine whether an object x is an exp_dist object.
is_mvn()
Function to determine whether an object x is an mvn object.
is_normal()
Function to determine whether an object x is an normal object.
marginal()
Generic method for obtaining the marginal distribution of a distribution object x over components indices.
marginal(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the marginal distribution of empirical_dist object x.
marginal(<mvn>)
Generic method for obtaining the marginal distribution of an mvn object x over components indices.
mean(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the mean of empirical_dist object x.
mean(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the mean of an exp_dist object.
mean(<mvn>)
Retrieve the mean of a mvn object.
mean(<normal>)
Retrieve the mean of a normal object.
mvn()
Construct (multivariate or univariate) normal distribution object.
nobs(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the number of observations in a empirical_dist object.
normal()
Construct univariate normal distribution object.
obs.empirical_dist()
Method for obtaining the data of a empirical_dist object.
params()
Generic method for obtaining the parameters of an object.
params(<exp_dist>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of an exp_dist object.
params(<mvn>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of a mvn object.
params(<normal>)
Method for obtaining the parameters of a normal object.
pdf()
Generic method for obtaining the pdf function of an object.
pdf(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the pdf of a empirical_dist object.
pdf(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the pdf of an exp_dist object.
pdf(<mvn>)
Method for obtaining the pdf of an mvn object.
pdf(<normal>)
Method for obtaining the pdf of an normal object.
print(<exp_dist>)
Print method for exp_dist objects.
print(<mvn>)
Method for printing an mvn object.
print(<normal>)
Method for printing a normal object.
quantile()
Generic method for obtaining the quantile (inverse cdf) of an object.
qunatile.exp_dist()
Method to obtain the inverse cdf of an exp_dist object.
rmap()
Generic method for applying a map f to distribution object x.
rmap(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the empirical distribution of a function of the observations of empirical_dist object x.
sample_mvn_region()
Function for obtaining sample points for an mvn object that is within the p-probability region.
sampler()
Generic method for obtaining the sampler of an object
sampler(<edist>)
Method for obtaining the sampler of an expr_dist object.
sampler(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the sampler for a empirical_dist object.
sampler(<exp_dist>)
Method to sample from an exp_dist object.
sampler(<mvn>)
Method for sampling from a mvn (multivariate normal) object.
sampler(<normal>)
Method for sampling from a normal object.
sup()
Generic method for retrieving the support of an object x.
sup(<exp_dist>)
Support for exponential distribution, the positive real numbers, (0, Inf).
sup(<mvn>)
Method for obtaining the support of a mvn object, where the support is defined as values that have non-zero probability density.
sup(<normal>)
Method for obtaining the support of a normal object, where the support is defined as values that have non-zero probability density.
surv()
Generic method for obtaining the survival function of an object.
surv(<exp_dist>)
Method to obtain the cdf of an exp_dist object.
vcov(<empirical_dist>)
Method for obtaining the variance of empirical_dist object x.
vcov(<exp_dist>)
Method for obtaining the variance of a exp_dist object.
vcov(<mvn>)
Retrieve the variance-covariance matrix (or scalar) of a mvn object. A variance-covariance matrix is a square matrix giving the covariance between each pair of elements of a given random vector. Importantly, its diagonal contains variances of the elements
vcov(<normal>)
Retrieve the variance-covariance matrix (or scalar) of a normal object. A variance-covariance matrix is a square matrix giving the covariance between each pair of elements of a given random vector. Importantly, its diagonal contains variances of the elements

Developed by Alexander Towell.
